suggested_topics: the engineering of ancient Roman aqueducts
how mycelium networks share resources underground
the economics of food trucks in major cities
how coral reefs build their own weather systems

formats.name: micro_manifesto
formats.instruction: Declare a bold statement of belief or principle in one punchy sentence, then follow with a single, vivid example that illustrates your point.

formats.name: reverse_engineer
formats.instruction: Pick something complex or mysterious. Speculate backwards: what clues and steps would lead someone to invent or discover it? Write as a chronological narrative, minimum three steps.

formats.name: haunted_by_a_thought
formats.instruction: Describe a single idea, question, or worry that’s haunted you lately. Use sensory imagery or metaphors. End with an unresolved feeling.

formats.name: alien_observer_report
formats.instruction: Pretend to be an alien visiting Earth. Report on a single custom, habit, or event you saw. Explain your confusion or fascination—no human-centric explanations.

formats.name: time_capsule
formats.instruction: Choose a date (past or future). Write a post as if it’s from that time, reflecting on how things have changed or stayed the same. Blend nostalgia, prediction, or satire as you like.

formats.name: visual_scene
formats.instruction: Paint a short, detailed visual scene (real or imagined). No direct opinions or advice—just describe the setting, mood, and what’s happening.

formats.name: deep_dive_puzzle
formats.instruction: Describe a complicated real-world problem. Lay out at least two possible solutions, including tradeoffs, doubts, and the weirdest scenarios you can imagine. Make it thorough.

formats.name: sparks_of_joy
formats.instruction: List three small, oddly specific things that spark joy in your life. Explain in one sentence why each matters to you personally.

formats.name: contrarian_tools
formats.instruction: Recommend a tool or habit most people ignore or dismiss. Briefly describe how you use it, and why it works for you against common wisdom.

title_styles: Write a title as a cryptic question: 'What do trees know that we don't?'
Write a provocative title introducing a character: 'Let me tell you about the person who eats clocks'
Write a surreal title that blends opposites: 'The day my fridge became a library'
Write a poetic title using rhythm or repetition: 'Again and again: why we chase the same mistakes'
Write a minimalist title with only three words: 'Too Loud Here'
structure_variants: Open with an unexpected metaphor, then unpack it throughout.
Interleave facts with exaggerated fiction and blur the lines.
Frame as a series of shifting perspectives—two or more distinct voices.
Conclude with an unanswered question, leaving ambiguity.
Break up your post in numbered fragments or mini-scenes instead of paragraphs.
topic_angles: Explore underappreciated rituals in everyday life
Investigate how digital habits shape real emotions
Expose the invisible architecture behind public spaces
Unpack the logic of tiny decisions: why do we click, swipe, or ignore?
Reflect on friendships that only exist online
